lead_paragraph: Playing without Carmelo Anthony in the second half, the United States hung on for a 90-86 victory over Brazil yesterday in Guangzhou, China. The United States led at halftime, 52-38, before Brazil went on a 16-0 run to take a 54-52 lead. Anthony scored 16 first-half points before being forced out with a knee injury when he slipped as he chased a ball with 2 minutes 21 seconds left in the half. He crashed into Coach Mike Krzyzewski and left the game with a hyperextended right knee. Krzyzewski said the injury did not appear to be serious.
